Original post:


This was another fun idea with dexterity based builds.

Privateer styled - Rogue Fighter Weapon Master, Dexterity based:
- 400+hp, 30 naked AC, uncanny dodge, epic dodge, evasion/improved evasion
- Base AB 46, Sneak Attack 9d6, Improved Knockdown, Crippling Strike, WS/EWS, Improved Critical/Ki Critical
- 335 skill points plus rogue class for heaps of skills, I chose stealth skills, tumble, UMD, dual detect, search, discipline (mostly to resist being disarmed) and disable trap

Keen rapier threat range is going to be 9-20/x3 which sounds pretty sweet to me. Of course with UMD so you can have that flaming rapier in the picture asap :)

Design wise I put the Str to 14 for carrying capacity and a little more damage without sneak particularly with the crits which one should get heaps of em.

Sneaks you can also get in with stealth, UMD with summons, improved knockdown or traps. 

I tried a Ranger 1 Cheese version for free dual wield but Fighter brought so much to the table in terms of playability. 

I also mucked around with monk for a while, deflect arrows/epic dodge/free improved knockdown and monk speed would have been awesome. A Rogue 18/WM 16/Monk 6 build ended up with 44 Base AB but Weapon Finesse ends up being taken at level 15 which is a bit late, and the even numbered rogue level I didn't particularly like, plus losing WS/EWS in a dex crit build didn't seem worth it.

I...Samphus wrote a Court Duellist Rogue 17/Fighter 4/WM19 which was strength based, it looked nice. 

I liked the character concept too with the naval privateer stuff. It's quite flexible alignment wise. He or she could be an neutral evil pirate raiding the seas, a chaotic neutral adventurer explorer visiting new lands, or lawful good noble ship's admiral defending the nation.

Anyway, sharing this for your consumption, it seems somewhat novel. Maybe there are some tweaks, happy to hear em as usual!

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
When I make DEX Rog/WM's I either go for Rog13/Figh8/WM19 or Rog19/Figh14/WM7.

Switching to Rog19/Figh14/WM7 loses 3 AB from WM levels, but you get +1 from BAB and another +1 from 2 more G DEX feats so you only lose 1 AB overall. You get plenty of feats in exchange for that 1 AB, so I would still recommend switching your level layout.
If you go elf or halfling you can increase AB further but that would mean either an XP penalty, which I know you dislike, or using a kukri, which wouldn't fit with your theme.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Nice comment Yunim, I believe you are right.
Plus you get all the combat feats sooner.
Gonna rework this baby.

Edit: Oh halfling doesn't have exp penalties from rogue. No problem there!

And a swashbuckling halfling with melee 47 AB wielding a rapier in two hands -> definitely that is something to see!

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Halflings and gnomes can't finesse rapiers, so if you go halfling then you will have to change your weapon.

Your current level layout is Rog21/Figh12/WM7, switching to Rog19/Figh14/WM7 gives you an extra Fighter feat which you can use for Armor Skin or a general feat if you rearrange your epic feats. An extra feat is usually more useful than +1d6 sneak attack and 12 skill points.

Your feat choices and skills look good, the only things I would change are the level layout and weapon choice. I assume that you are planning on using Find Traps wands on WoG, since you have high Disable Trap but low Search?
